text: Kip Stephen Thorne (born June 1, 1940) is an American theoretical physicist and Nobel laureate. He is known for his contributions in gravitational physics and astrophysics. In 2017, Thorne was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics along with Rainer Weiss and Barry C. Barish "for decisive contributions to the LIGO detector and the observation of gravitational waves". ==References== Category:1940 births Category:Living people Category:California Institute of Technology faculty Category:American astronomers Category:American atheists Category:American Nobel Prize winners Category:American astrophysicists Category:Scientists from Utah Category:Princeton University alumni Category:American theoretical physicists
title: Kip Thorne
